text: Imidazole (ImH) is a molecule and an organic compound.https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/nursing-and-health- professions/imidazole#:~:text=Imidazole%201%20is%20a%20five,used%20in%20the%20chemical%20literature. ScienceDirect. Retrieved 2023-02-25 Its chemical formula is C3N2H4. It is a white or colourless solid that is soluble in water, producing a mildly alkaline solution. Many natural products, especially alkaloids, have the imidazole ring. This ring system is present in important biological building blocks, such as histidine, and the related hormone, histamine. ==References== Category:Organonitrogen compounds
title: Imidazole
